title: Dad's Creamy Cucumber Salad Recipe
description: This creamy cucumber salad pairs crisp cucumber slices with a creamy mayo and vinegar dressing. It's sure to be a family-favorite this summer!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Vegetable Salad Recipes Cucumber Salad Recipes Dad's Creamy Cucumber Salad 4.7 (514) 435 Reviews 36 Photos This creamy cucumber salad was my dad's recipe. It's one of our family's all-time summer favorites. Submitted by MHudson Updated on August 8, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 36 36 36 36 Prep Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Crisp and creamy cucumber salad makes the perfect summer side. This old-fashioned recipe combines thinly sliced sweet onions, cucumbers, dill, garlic, and mayo for an unbelievably delicious make-ahead dish. Try your hand at MHudson's family recipe for the tastiest cucumber salad ever. How to Make Creamy Cucumber Salad Making a refreshing cucumber salad couldn't be simpler. You'll find the full recipe below with step-by-step instructions, but here's what you can expect when you make this top-rated recipe: Begin by combining salt, cucumbers, and onions in a bowl and allowing the mixture to sit at room temperature for 15-30 minutes. Next, drain the mixture in a colander placed over a bowl or sink before incorporating mayonnaise, vinegar, and seasonings. Cover and refrigerate for one to two hours before serving. The result is a tantalizingly creamy side dish that will keep you coming back for more. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  What to Serve With Creamy Cucumber Salad Looking for something to serve alongside this creamy cucumber and onion salad? This tangy, sweet, and totally satisfying recipe pairs well with a range of dishes. Try a hearty beef dish like Beef Sukiyaki to balance the flavor scales or keep things light with a roasted lemon-herb chicken. How Long Does Creamy Cucumber Salad Last in the Fridge? While creamy cucumber salad is best enjoyed the day it's made, it can be stored in the refrigerator for 4-5 days. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Delicious," according to JenL. "Make sure you follow the directions to salt, sit and drain. I used a little less mayonnaise and added sour cream. Fresh dill from the garden put it over the top!" "This was awesome and very easy to make," raves svcran. "I added a little more garlic to mine. Will definitely make again!" Editorial contributions by Rai Mincey Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 large cucumbers, peeled and thinly sliced 1 sweet onion, thinly sliced 1 tablespoon sea salt Dressing: 1 ½ cups mayonnaise, or more to taste 2 tablespoons vinegar 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon dried dill weed 1 teaspoon garlic powder 1 teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Mix cucumbers, onion, and salt together in a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let sit for 15 to 30 minutes. Turn cucumber mixture into a colander set over a bowl or in a sink. Let drain, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid and salt has drained, 15 to 30 minutes. Transfer drained cucumber mixture to a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, dill, garlic powder, and pepper for dressing together in a bowl until smooth. Pour over cucumber mixture and stir until coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour over cucumber mixture and stir until coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  Recipe Tip If the sauce is too runny for your liking, add a bit more mayonnaise. I Made It Print 752 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 320 Calories 33g Fat 7g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 320 % Daily Value * Total Fat 33g 42% Saturated Fat 5g 25% Cholesterol 16mg 5% Sodium 897mg 39% Total Carbohydrate 7g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 3g Protein 1g 2% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 21mg 2% Iron 8mg 46% Potassium 153mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Dad's Creamy Cucumber Salad 01 of 36 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 36 Photo by  M Garza 03/21/2025 A keeper! Crowd-pleaser Easy to follow Followed the recipe, added a bit of horseradish. It was gone at the end of church potluck. Made more and chopped the celery n onion mix, spread on bread as tea sandwiches for a ladies luncheon. Gone again! Was asked for recipe, and referred them to this one. Thanks for the great recipe! 03 of 36 Photo by  Hollmart 05/26/2024 The best cucumber salad I’ve had yet !!! I did add the sour cream and celery seed to me dill weed and celery seed go hand and hand …Love this ❤️.’’’ So I need to add that after I drained the cucumbers I rinsed them and laid them out on paper towels to absorb the liquid 04 of 36 Photo by  Angela Anderson 10/08/2023 My husband hates cucumbers. We recently had a party to attend and I made this and another cucumber salad that was his aunts recipe. He tried them both and has now requested this one 3x’s since then. This is a big hit!!! 05 of 36 Photo by  Mary Edel 08/26/2022 Tasty. With cucumbers planted for the first time from my little garden . Also gave a little to family member in mason jar. 06 of 36 Photo by  Jennifer Baker 07/28/2022 This is soooo good! My boss’s wife sent him to work with this cucumber salad for me to try since I love to cook. It’s amazing after it’s had time for the flavors to blend. This is not a recipe for impatient people! Let the cucumbers and onions sit for the stated time, then pour them in a colander to drain about 30 minutes(or longer). It’s perfect to use up the cucumbers in my garden! 07 of 36 Photo by  S Gilmore 04/01/2021 Way too salty. Way too much mayonaise for only 2 cucumbers and an onion. I followed the recipe to the T. I let the cucumbers soak and drain properly. I even put in a salad spinner afterwards to get excess salt off. I didn't have any more cucumbers to lessen the salt. Excess mayonaise makes this a cucumber soup. 08 of 36 Photo by  1184MaryKate 08/31/2020 09 of 36 Photo by  Kimberly Belonga 06/19/2020 10 of 36 Photo by  Camille Majid 06/09/2020 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Mom's Cucumbers 326 Ratings Crisp Marinated Cucumbers 141 Ratings Fresh Frozen Cucumbers 13 Ratings Cucumber Slices with Dill 209 Ratings Mom's Cucumber Salad 608 Ratings Honeydew and Cucumber Salad 9 Ratings Victoria's Cucumber Salad 33 Ratings Creamed Cucumber Slices 94 Ratings Sunomono (Japanese Cucumber Salad) 339 Ratings Thai Cucumber Salad 590 Ratings Smashed Cucumber Salad 82 Ratings Ginger-Spiced Cucumbers 20 Ratings Cooler Than A Cucumber Salad 8 Ratings Summertime Cucumber Salad 6 Ratings Lemony Cucumbers 79 Ratings Asian Cucumber Salad 123 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
